gnat.preprocessing
Class NameRangeExpander

java.lang.Object
  gnat.preprocessing.NameRangeExpander
All Implemented Interfaces:
Filter
public class NameRangeExpander
extends java.lang.Object
implements Filter

Rewrites name ranges in texts, for instance, replacing "freac-1 to freac-3" with "freac-1, freac-2, and freac-3".

Note that thereby the original text is changed, replacing each Text's plain text value.

This expander should be called prior any gene name recognition filter!

Author:
Conrad, Jörg

Method Detail

filter

public void filter(Context context,
                   TextRepository textRepository,
                   GeneRepository geneRepository)
Description copied from interface: Filter
The minimum filtering method that has to be implemented. A Run will call this method for each filter in sequence.
Each filter can read and potentially change context, textRepository, and geneRepository in this method.

Specified by:
filter in interface Filter

getCombination

static java.lang.String getCombination(java.lang.String[] args)
Combines the given arguments into an expanded output string. First argument has to be the base name of the gene, the second argument the intermediate string (dash, white space, can also be empty). All following arguments are the numbers (digits, Roman, letters) of each individual gene, which get attached to the base name and the intermediate string. For two names, joins them with an "and"; for more than two names, joins them with ",", and an ", and" for the last instance.

Example: call with {"MURF", "-", "1", "2", "3"}
Result: "MURF-1, MURF-2, and MURF-3".

Parameters:
args -
Returns:

sanityCheck

static boolean sanityCheck(java.lang.String basename,
                           java.lang.String[] numbers)
Checks the given base name and numbers if they make sense
  • the base name should look like a gene name
  • the numbers should be of the same type (digits, letters, or Roman) and case
  • the numbers should be in ascending order
  • no number should not be zero
Threre are cases in the BC2 set where the order was not maintained => skip that particular check!

Parameters:
basename -
numbers -
Returns:
